description.p: A cantrip dating back to the Netherese Empire. Records indicate Archmage Malazar created a cantrip capable of assisting the healers of Netheril.

You cause lightning to crackle at your fingertips and target a creature within range. If the target is unconscious and dying, you grant them advantage on their next death saving throw. If the target is hostile to you, they must make a dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 lightning damage.
At Higher Levels.The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
A cantrip dating back to the Netherese Empire. Iceweaver records state one, Malazar created this cantrip as an apprentice to Archmage Karsus.
glaciate a mass of ice crystals around yourself and launch a beam of boreal air at an enemy or object within range.

Make a ranged spell attack, on a hit the target takes 1d6 cold damage plus an amount equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (20 charisma would be a +5 damage). This spell will instantly extinguish campfires or freeze a gallon of water.

At Higher Levels. The damage increases by an amount equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at 5th level (1d6 + 2 times modifier), 11th level (1d6 + 3 times modifier), and 17th level (1d6 + 4 times modifier).
You conjure an icicle from the moisture in the air and hurl it at a target.

You create a long shard of ice and immediately hurl it in a straight line up to 60 feet in a direction you choose before evaporating, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the shard of ice strikes the target and shatters, dealing 1d8 piercing damage.
At Higher Levels. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Mastery: Frozen Shard Barrage: When you cast Ice Spear, you can expend additional energy to launch multiple shards of ice. As part of the casting, you can create two additional shards, which can be thrown at separate targets within 60 feet of the original line. Each shard deals 1d8 piercing damage and requires a separate Dexterity saving throw for each target.
Touch a non-magical tool. It becomes magical with a +1 to ability check rolls until the spell ends.

You create three medium bolts of ice, and shoot them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the creature takes 1d6 cold damage. If at least 3 bolts hit a single creature, and the creature fails a constitution saving thow, it applies the Chilled condition, if attuned to Mourning Frost until the start of your next turn.
Creatures that are resistant or immune to cold damage automatically succeed the saving throw.
At Higher Levels.When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create one additional bolt for each slot level above 1st.

Documented as being created by the Apprentice Malazar during the Crown Wars, this spell creates a regenerating abjurative force field around a single willing creature you can see within range. For the duration, at the start of each of its turns it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to spell cast level plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
These temporary hit points disappear when the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may add your proficiency modifier to the temporary hit points value.

p.quote: "The Ward is a shield of hope for the faithful and despair for the broken."

description.p: This spell creates a temporary quasi-real workshop in a 10’x10’ area. Choose a type of artisan’s tools, a workshop containing those tools and its associated gear appears.

For example, choosing Smith’s Tools would cause quasi-real hammers, tongs, pliers to appear along with an anvil, forge, fuel and bellows. A person who is proficient with the chosen tools can use this phantom workshop as effectively as a real workshop.

Any of the equipment or materials created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried outside the area or when the spell ends. Therefore, it’s necessary to provide real raw materials to create anything that lasts after the spell ends.

setters.set: A small piece of rare metal worth 25 gp. Used in the process

description.p: Choose a willing creature and a suit of armor that creature is proficient with. The armor briefly animates and instantly becomes donned or doffed by the creature.

You point your finger at a creature you can see within range, and a thin beam of lightning rushes to your target. Make a range spell attack against the creature. On a hit, it takes 3d6 lightning damage and must succeed on a constitution saving throw or fall prone.
If the target is resistant or immune to lightning damage, it automatically succeeds the saving throw.
At higher levels,when you cast this spell using a 3rd-level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each level above 2nd, up to a maximum of 9d6

You enchant the weapon you’re holding with frost magic. The weapon glows white, radiating a freezing mist. The first time on each of your turns that you hit with the enchanted weapon, you deal an extra 1d8 cold damage
At Higher Levels. When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1D8 for each slot level above 2nd.

You drive the pin used in the spell’s casting into the ground, forcing a creature you can see within range to succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have its spirit shackled to an invisible spiritual anchor at a point in the creature’s space
At the end of each of that creature’s turns, it takes 1d6 Psychic damage for each 5 feet away from that anchor that it ends its turn (maximum 10d6).

This spell is said to be a remnant of Netherese spirit-binding techniques once used by Archmage Malazar in his arcane experiments. Designed to tether souls in place, it was a precursor to void-anchoring rituals.

setters.set: a silver pin worth 5+ SP, which the spell consumes

description.p: You create a large, translucent bubble that envelops you. While inside the bubble, you hover 5 feet above the groundand you can hover around at a speed of 20 feet.

The bubble provides you with protection, giving you a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, the next ranged attack or melee attack that would hit you has disadvantage, if the attack requires a saving throw you have advantage on the roll. When the concentration or spell ends, the bubble will pop and you fall prone.

p.em: "Sphere of safety, rise and float. Protect and carry, this I devote."

description.p: As a reaction to being attacked, you may use your reaction to summon a barrier of shimmering ice that absorbs the damage you would have taken. The icy shield has 30 hit points and lasts until the end of your next turn. The shield is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to cold damage.

On your turn, if the shield has remaining hit points, you can use a bonus action to transmute it into an icicle and make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 cold damage, plus the remaining hit points of the shield. Alternatively, you can convert the shield back into the material component.

At Higher Levels. When cast using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the shield’s hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 3rd. alternatively you may upcast to use your reaction to target an ally within 30 ft that is attacked, however the shield may only have the base HP value.

Mastery: Cryomatic Warding: Great Cryomancers can perfect the shield sculpting process. When struck by cold damage, the shield gains additional hit points equal to half the cold damage that would have been dealt.

setters.set: a piece of ice carved to resemble a shield, consumed in the casting

description.p: A spell dating back to the Netherese Empire. Records indicate Archmage Malazar created a frost spell so powerful it could freeze the very bones of enemies.
With a click of your fingers you summon a dreadful cold upon a target creature within range.

That creature must make a constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failed save target creature takes 2d8 cold damage, reduces ground movement by half, and takes an additional 1d6 cold damage the first time it takes damage from any source during the duration. On a successful save the target takes half damage and experiences no other effects. Creatures who fail there save may repeat it at the start of each of their turns.
Creatures with resistance to cold damage have advantage on the saving throw. Creatures with immunity to cold automatically succeed on the save.
At higher levels.When cast using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage dealth increases by 1d8 per spell slot level, and the additional cold damage increases by 1d6 per spell slot level.
Mastery: Entrapping Ice: The target’s movement is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

Created by Upper Arcanist Malazar to counteract fireball spells during the Crown Wars. Upon casting, an icy streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range then blossoms with a crystalline crackle into an explosion of ice. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the cold damage increases by 1d6 for every one level above 3rd.
A spell few would dare to learn, outlawed even to mages of Thay. Dating back to the Netherese Empire. A spell created by the late Archmage Malazar

You summon a small void rift in your palm, siphoning energy from a magical source or creature. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or lose a spell slot (chosen at random). You regain hit points equal to twice the slot’s level.
If the target succeeds on the saving throw you instead lose the spell slot they would have lost (or the closest equivalent).

You create an immobile dome of protective force with a radius of 10 feet around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The dome has 30 hit points. You choose any number of creatures when you cast this spell so they can move through it. All other creatures are barred from passing through it.

When a creature outside of the dome targets another creature inside, they target the dome instead. Whenever a creature inside the dome takes damage from another creature from outside, the dome takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the dome to 0 hit points, the creature takes any remaining damage and the dome is destroyed. The dome only takes damage once from spells with an area of effect. The dome disappears after 1 minute passes or it reaches 0 HP.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the Hit points of the dome increases by 10 for each slot level above 3rd.

setters.set: A small glass marble worth 20 gp, used in the spell casting.

description.p: You touch a suit of medium or heavy armor. Until the spell ends, the chosen armor's weight is reduced by half, it no longer imposes disadvantage on stealth checks if it would do so otherwise, and if it has a strength requirement that requirement is reduced by 3.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may affect an extra set of armour.

The target’s impact echoes as a second shock slams it further into the ground. The target must make a constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 3D8 Bludgeoning damage and has the dazed condition until the end of its turn.
At Higher Levels. The damage increases by 2d8 for every slot level above 3.

setters.set: Reaction, which you can take when a target gains the prone condition

description.p: You raise a hand and fire forth a crackling spark that ignites the air around it.
Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 fire plus 3d8 Lightning damage.

If this attack was made with advantage, the spark additionally explodes on a hit, forcing each other creature within 10 feet of the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes half the attack’s damage.

Derived from the unstable energy experiments of Archmage Malazar, this spell was originally a Netherese weapon of war. Malazar sought to fuse opposing elemental forces, fire and lightning, into a single volatile magic. Though the Empire fell, remnants of his research persisted in arcane circles, warning of its destructive power.
You quicken the blood of a creature within range; for the duration, the creature can make a melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of its turns, and attacks that target it have advantage.
An unwilling creature targeted by this spell can make a Constitution saving throw, resisting the effect on a success

Legends tell of Archmage Malazar using a version of this spell on his own soldiers, granting them relentless vitality at the cost of their own safety. The spell fuels warriors with an unnatural hunger for battle, even as their bodies burned from within.

You call down a bolt of baleful red lightning from above a creature you can see within 120 feet. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) lightning plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage, or half as much on a success
A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is unaffected by the first source of healing it receives before the beginning of its next turn.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of Level 4 or higher, the Necrotic damage dealt by it increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3.

Dazzling starlight rains down from above. Up to three creatures of your choice within range regain hit points equal to 1D6 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Additionally, the creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting abilitiy modifier.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number of creatures that can be affected increases by 1.

You touch a weapon and imbue it with a dark hunger from the void. Until the spell ends, weapon attacks made with it deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage on a hit, the amount of necrotic damage on the roll will be given to the weapon's wielder as temporary hit points. Temporary hit points from this do not stack. If the weapon isn’t already a magic weapon, it becomes one for the duration.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may deal an extra 1d8 damage.

setters.set: blood from your hand, taking 1d4 damage

description.p:
You thrust your staff into the ground and summon a freezing tornado around you. When you cast this spell, ALL creatures within 30 feet from you must make a Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save, they take 4d6 cold damage and applies the Chilled condition, if attuned to Mourning Frost until the start of your next turn.
On a success, they only take half the damage rolled.
While you mantain concentration, if a creature starts their turn within 30 feet of you, they must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d6 cold damage. On a success, they only take half the damage rolled.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage of the tornado summon increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

According to Iceweaver records, this spell was created in −3830 DR by Archmage Malazar for the climactic battles of the Netherese schism, capable of unleashing devastating cold to immobilize enemies and disrupt their formations, no matter the cost.

A beam of iridescent blue fire forming a line 60 foot long and 5 foot wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4D8 Radiant Damage OR Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may deal an extra 1d8 damage per damage type.

You draw upon your knowledge of enchantments to shatter another creature's connection to an item. Choose a magic item that you can see and that another creature is attuned to. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's attunement to the chosen magic item is broken. If the item is cursed, the attunement cannot be broken by this spell.

setters.set: A pair of scissors or shears.
